page.title: 14World Service Radio Masts
page.content: An application in January 1983 by the BBC on behalf of the Foreign and Commonwealth Office to erect 30 towers some 300ft high and six high frequency transmitters in Bearley was immediately rejected by the Parish, District and County Councils. Although this proposal would create the largest Transmitter Station in Europe and effect an area of 80 sq miles around Bearley the BBC considered the World Service Transmitter so important that it referred the application to the Secretary of State. A Public enquiry was arranged and a battle then ensued between the BBC and local Opposition Groups. Details of possible effect on households, electronic firms, Computer Specialists etc were thrashed out and transmission strengths simulated to test theatre
